definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]

sentences.english: No one will lie down under the deep humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 誰也不會甘心忍受這一奇恥大辱。

sentences.english: More than one person mentioned this matter, and lead to the palace to permit someone.
sentences.chinese: 不止一人提到此事，並引爲故宮的奇恥大辱。

sentences.english: We will never forger the immense insult of being called "Oriental Sick Men".
sentences.chinese: 我們永遠不會忘記“東亞病夫”的奇恥大辱。

sentences.english: Sean felt humiliated to hear his talent being questioned.
sentences.chinese: 聽到有人質疑他的才能，肖恩覺得受了奇恥大辱。

sentences.english: The marriage was considered especially ignominious since she was of royal descent.
sentences.chinese: 由於她出身王族，這門婚事被認爲是奇恥大辱。
